alcohols.name: Old Fashion
instructions: A few dashes of plain water (optional)
alcohols.information: An Old Fashioned is a timeless classic cocktail. To craft this iconic drink, start by placing a sugar cube in an old-fashioned glass and saturating it with 2 dashes of Angostura bitters. If you prefer a sweeter variant, add a few dashes of plain water to help dissolve the sugar. Gently muddle the sugar and bitters until the sugar is dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes, and then pour in 2 oz. of your choice of bourbon or rye whiskey. Stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients, and garnish with a twist of orange or lemon peel, expressing the citrus oils over the drink for an added aroma. Alternatively, you can use an olive as a garnish. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the whiskey.

alcohols.name: Margarita
instructions: 1 oz orange liqueur (such as triple sec or Cointreau)
1/2 oz simple syrup (optional, adjust based on taste preference)
alcohols.information: A Margarita is a popular and classic cocktail known for its refreshing taste. To make this iconic drink, use the following instructions: Prepare the glass by running a lime wedge around the rim, then dip the rim into salt to coat it. Fill the glass with ice. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the tequila, freshly squeezed lime juice, orange liqueur, and simple syrup (if using) to the shaker. Shake well for about 15-20 seconds to chill the mixture. Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.

alcohols.name: Manhattan
instructions: Maraschino cherry or orange twist (for garnish)
alcohols.information: A Manhattan is a classic cocktail that's been around for well over a century. It's known for its simple yet sophisticated taste. To make a Manhattan, follow this simple recipe: Fill a mixing glass or cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in the rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, and add the dashes of Angostura bitters. Stir well (for about 30 seconds) or shake gently to chill the mixture. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass (typically a coupe glass or a martini glass). Garnish the drink with a maraschino cherry or an orange twist. You can express the oils from the orange twist over the drink by giving it a gentle twist to release the aroma.

alcohols.name: Martini
instructions: Lemon twist or olive for garnish
alcohols.information: The martini is one of the most iconic cocktails of all time. To craft this classic drink, start by chilling a cocktail glass in the freezer for at least 10 minutes. Then, fill a mixing glass with ice cubes and pour in 2 oz. of gin or vodka. Add 1/2 oz. of dry vermouth, and stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients. Next, strain the mixture into the chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist or olive, and serve. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Piña Colada
instructions: Pineapple slice and maraschino cherry for garnish
alcohols.information: The piña colada is a classic tropical cocktail with rum, pineapple and coconut milk. To make a piña colada, start by adding 2 oz. of white rum, 3 oz. of pineapple juice and 1 oz. of coconut cream to a blender. Then, add 1 cup of crushed ice and blend the mixture until it's smooth. Pour the drink into a glass, and garnish with a pineapple slice and maraschino cherry. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Blue Lagoon
instructions: Lemon slice and maraschino cherry for garnish
alcohols.information: The Blue Lagoon is a classic cocktail with vodka, blue curaçao and lemonade. To make a Blue Lagoon, start by adding 1 1/2 oz. of vodka and 1/2 oz. of blue curaçao to a highball glass filled with ice. Then, fill the glass with lemonade and stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients. Garnish with a lemon slice and maraschino cherry, and serve. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Mojito
alcohols.information: The mojito is a classic Cuban cocktail with rum, mint and lime juice. To make a mojito, start by adding 2 oz. of white rum, 1 oz. of lime juice, 2 tsp. of sugar and 6 mint leaves to a highball glass. Then, gently muddle the mint leaves with a muddler or wooden spoon. Next, fill the glass with ice cubes and top it off with club soda. Stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients, and garnish with a mint sprig. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Bloody Mary
instructions: Celery stalk and lemon wedge for garnish
alcohols.information: The Bloody Mary is a classic brunch cocktail with vodka, tomato juice and a combination of spices and flavorings. To make a Bloody Mary, start by adding 1 1/2 oz. of vodka, 3 oz. of tomato juice and 1/2 oz. of lemon juice to a highball glass. Then, add a few dashes of Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, celery salt and pepper. Stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients, and garnish with a celery stalk and lemon wedge. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Cosmopolitan
alcohols.information: The cosmopolitan is a classic cocktail with vodka, triple sec, cranberry juice and lime juice. To make a cosmopolitan, start by adding 1 1/2 oz. of vodka, 1 oz. of cranberry juice, 1/2 oz. of triple sec and 1/2 oz. of lime juice to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Then, shake the mixture vigorously for 10 to 15 seconds. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with a lime wedge. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Aperol Spritz
alcohols.information: The Aperol spritz is a classic Italian cocktail with Prosecco, Aperol and soda water. To make an Aperol spritz, start by adding 3 oz. of Prosecco, 2 oz. of Aperol and 1 oz. of soda water to a wine glass filled with ice. Then, stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients, and garnish with an orange slice. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Moscow Mule
alcohols.information: The Moscow Mule is a refreshing and zesty cocktail with a signature copper mug presentation. To craft this drink, start by filling a copper mug or highball glass with ice. Squeeze the juice from half a lime into the glass, and drop the spent lime shell in. Then, pour in 2 oz. of vodka. Top it off with approximately 4 oz. of ginger beer, or adjust to your preferred level of ginger flavor. Give it a gentle stir to mix the ingredients. To garnish, add a lime wheel or wedge for an extra burst of citrus aroma. The Moscow Mule is known for its crisp and tangy taste, making it a popular choice for a refreshing and enjoyable cocktail.

alcohols.name: Espresso Martini
alcohols.information: The espresso martini is a classic cocktail with vodka, Kahlúa and espresso. To make an espresso martini, start by adding 1 1/2 oz. of vodka, 1 oz. of Kahlúa and 1 oz. of espresso to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Then, shake the mixture vigorously for 10 to 15 seconds. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with 3 coffee beans. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Vodka Cranberry
alcohols.information: The vodka cranberry is a classic cocktail with vodka and cranberry juice. To make a vodka cranberry, start by adding 2 oz. of vodka and 4 oz. of cranberry juice to a highball glass filled with ice. Then, stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients, and garnish with a lime wedge. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Sex on the Beach
instructions: Orange slice and maraschino cherry for garnish
alcohols.information: Sex on the Beach is a tropical and fruity cocktail that's both colorful and delightful. To create this cocktail, start by filling a highball glass with ice. Pour in 1.5 oz. of vodka and 3/4 oz. of peach schnapps. Add 2 oz. of cranberry juice and 2 oz. of orange juice. Give it a gentle stir to mix the ingredients and create the vibrant layered look. To garnish, you can add a maraschino cherry and a slice of orange or a twist of orange peel. The result is a sweet and fruity concoction that's perfect for sipping by the beach or on a sunny day. Enjoy your Sex on the Beach!

alcohols.name: Sangria
instructions: 2 cups chopped mixed fruits (e.g., oranges, lemons, limes, apples, berries)
2 cups carbonated water or lemon-lime soda (for serving, optional)
alcohols.information: Sangria is a classic cocktail with red wine, brandy and fruit. To make sangria, start by combining the red wine, brandy, or orange liqueur, and sugar. Stir well to dissolve the sugar. Add the mixed chopped fruits, orange slices, and lemon slices. Mix gently. Cover the mixture and refridgerate for at least 2-4 hours. To serve, fill glasses with ice. Pour the sangria into the glasses, making sure to include some fruit pieces in each serving. Top each glass with a splash of carbonated water or lemon-lime soda for a bit of fizz (optional).

alcohols.name: Sonic Screwdriver
alcohols.information: The Sonic Screwdriver is a refreshing and zesty cocktail with a signature copper mug presentation. To craft this drink, start by filling a copper mug or highball glass with ice. Squeeze the juice from half a lime into the glass, and drop the spent lime shell in. Then, pour in 2 oz. of vodka. Top it off with approximately 4 oz. of ginger beer, or adjust to your preferred level of ginger flavor. Give it a gentle stir to mix the ingredients. To garnish, add a lime wheel or wedge for an extra burst of citrus aroma. The Sonic Screwdriver is known for its crisp and tangy taste, making it a popular choice for a refreshing and enjoyable cocktail.

alcohols.name: Gimlet
alcohols.information: A Gimlet is a classic cocktail known for its simplicity and refreshing taste. To make this tangy cocktail, start by filling the cocktail shaker with ice. Add the gin, freshly squeezed lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker. Shake well for about 15-20 seconds to chill the mixture. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass (such as a coupe glass or a martini glass) over fresh ice. Garnish the drink with a lime wheel or a twist.

alcohols.name: Spiced Wine
alcohols.information: Spiced wine is a classic cocktail with red wine, brandy and spices. To make spiced wine, start by adding 1/4 cup of brandy and 1/4 cup of honey to a saucepan. Then, add 1 sliced orange, 1 sliced lemon and 1 sliced lime. Next, add 1 cinnamon stick, 1 star anise, 1 tsp. of whole cloves, 1 tsp. of whole allspice, 1 tsp. of whole black peppercorns, 1 tsp. of whole cardamom pods and 1 tsp. of juniper berries. Finally, pour in 1 bottle of red wine. Heat the mixture over medium heat until it reaches a simmer. Then, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Strain the mixture into a pitcher, and serve warm. The result is a beautifully simple yet sophisticated cocktail that's all about savoring the rich flavors of the liquor.

alcohols.name: Negroni
alcohols.information: A Negroni is a bold, classic Italian cocktail known for its balance of bitter and sweet flavors. To make a Negroni: Fill a mixing glass or a shaker with ice. Add the gin, Campari, and sweet vermouth to the shaker. Stir well for about 20-30 seconds to chill the mixture. Some variations involve stirring over ice for dilution. Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice or into a chilled cocktail glass. Express the oils from the orange peel over the drink by holding it over the glass and giving it a gentle twist. Then, garnish the drink with the peel.

alcohols.name: Gin and Tonic
alcohols.information: The Gin and Tonic is a classic cocktail with a signature copper mug presentation. To craft this drink, start by filling a copper mug or highball glass with ice. Squeeze the juice from half a lime into the glass, and drop the spent lime shell in. Then, pour in 2 oz. of gin. Top it off with approximately 4 oz. of tonic water, or adjust to your preferred level of tonic flavor. Give it a gentle stir to mix the ingredients. To garnish, add a lime wheel or wedge for an extra burst of citrus aroma. The Gin and Tonic is known for its crisp and tangy taste, making it a popular choice for a refreshing and enjoyable cocktail.

alcohols.name: Dark and Stormy
alcohols.information: The Dark and Stormy is a classic cocktail with a signature copper mug presentation. To craft this drink, start by filling a copper mug or highball glass with ice. Squeeze the juice from half a lime into the glass, and drop the spent lime shell in. Then, pour in 2 oz. of dark rum. Top it off with approximately 3 oz. of ginger beer, or adjust to your preferred level of ginger flavor. Give it a gentle stir to mix the ingredients. To garnish, add a lime wheel or wedge for an extra burst of citrus aroma. The Dark and Stormy is known for its crisp and tangy taste, making it a popular choice for a refreshing and enjoyable cocktail.

alcohols.name: Mimosa
alcohols.information: A Mimosa is a classic and popular cocktail. To make this refreshing drink, follow this recipe: Chill the orange juice and the champagne or sparkling wine in advance. In a champagne flute or a wine glass, pour the chilled orange juice. Top it off with the chilled champagne or sparkling wine. Gently stir to combine, though some prefer to leave it unstirred to maintain the bubbly effervescence. Garnish the drink with an orange slice or twist.

alcohols.name: Daiquiri
alcohols.information: A Daiquiri is a classic cocktail known for its simplicity and refreshing taste. To make a classic Daiquiri, fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the white rum, freshly squeezed lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker. Shake well for about 15-20 seconds to chill the mixture. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass, such as a coupe glass or a martini glass. Garnish the drink with a lime wheel or wedge.

alcohols.name: Irish Coffee
alcohols.information: Irish coffee is a warm and comforting cocktail that combines coffee, Irish whiskey, sugar, and topped with whipped cream. To make Irish Coffee, start by brewing your favorite coffee. Pour it into a pre-warmed glass or mug. Add the brown sugar to the hot coffee and stir until dissolved. Stir in the Irish whiskey. Top the coffee with a generous dollop of whipped cream. You can garnish the whipped cream with a sprinkle of cocoa powder or nutmeg for added flavor if desired. The key to a good Irish coffee is using freshly brewed hot coffee, quality Irish whiskey, and properly whipped cream to top it off.

alcohols.name: Paloma
instructions: Grapefruit soda OR 3 oz grapefruit juice and 1 1/2 oz soda water
Salt or chili powder (for rimming the glass, optional)
alcohols.information: A Paloma is a refreshing and popular cocktail that originates from Mexico. Follow this recipe to make a Paloma: Fill the glass with ice. In a shaker, combine the tequila, freshly squeezed lime juice, and grapefruit juice. Shake well to mix the ingredients thoroughly. Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over ice. If using grapefruit soda, top off the glass with it. If not, use grapefruit juice and add soda water. Garnish the drink with a lime wedge or wheel.
